1{-# LANGUAGE OverloadedStrings #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Text lines delimited by carriage returns or line feeds.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Code.Line
7  ( -- * Line
8    LineNumber,
9    NumberedLine,
10    linesCrlf, linesCrlfNumbered,
11    linesCrlfBz, linesCrlfBzNumbered,
12    dropBom,
13
14    -- * CodeLine
15    CodeLine (..),
16    IndentSize,
17    lineIndentPair,
18  ) where
19
20import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy                 as Bz
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort           as B
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO              as B
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude         as B
24
25
26-- ----------------------  Line
27
28-- | Line number.
29type LineNumber = Int
30
31-- | Line with number.
32type NumberedLine = (LineNumber, String)
33
34-- | Split string into lines.
35--   The result strings do not contain
36--   carriage returns (@\\r@)
37--   and line feeds (@\\n@).
38--
39--   >>> linesCrlf "aaa\nbbb\r\nccc\n\nddd\n"
40--   ["aaa","bbb","ccc","","ddd"]
41linesCrlf :: String -> [String]
42linesCrlf "" = []
43linesCrlf s = ln : next s2 where
44    (ln, s2) = break (`elem` ("\r\n" :: String)) s
45    next ('\r' : s3) = next s3
46    next ('\n' : s3) = linesCrlf s3
47    next s3          = linesCrlf s3
48
49-- | Line number and its content.
50linesCrlfNumbered :: String -> [NumberedLine]
51linesCrlfNumbered = zip [1..] . linesCrlf
52
53-- | Split lazy bytestring by newline character sequence.
54--   This function drops the BOM sequence.
55linesCrlfBz :: (B.ToCode code) => code -> [B.Bz]
56linesCrlfBz = linesCrlfBzRaw . dropBom
57
58-- | Split lazy bytestring by newline character sequence.
59linesCrlfBzRaw :: (B.ToCode code) => code -> [B.Bz]
60linesCrlfBzRaw = loop . B.toCode where
61    loop bz
62        | Bz.null bz  = []
63        | otherwise   = case Bz.break crlf bz of
64                          (ln, bz') -> ln : loop (strip bz')
65                          
66    crlf n = (n == lf) || (n == cr)
67    lf = 10 -- '\n'
68    cr = 13 -- '\r'
69
70    strip bz2 = case Bz.uncons bz2 of
71                  Nothing -> bz2
72                  Just (c , bz2')
73                      | c == cr   -> strip bz2'
74                      | c == lf   -> bz2'
75                      | otherwise -> bz2
76
77-- | Create numbered lines from lazy bytestring.
78linesCrlfBzNumbered :: (B.ToCode code) => code -> [NumberedLine]
79linesCrlfBzNumbered = zip [1..] . linesCrlfBzString
80
81-- | Create string lines from lazy bytestring.
82linesCrlfBzString :: (B.ToCode code) => code -> [String]
83linesCrlfBzString = map B.bzString . linesCrlfBz
84
85-- | Remove UTF-8 BOM (EF BB BF) from lazy bytestring.
86dropBom :: (B.ToCode code) => code -> B.Bz
87dropBom code =
88    let bz = B.toCode code
89    in case Bz.splitAt 3 bz of
90         (bom, body) | "\xEF\xBB\xBF" `Bz.isPrefixOf` bom -> body
91                     | otherwise                          -> bz
92
93
94-- ----------------------  CodeLine
95
96-- | Tokens in line.
97data CodeLine a = CodeLine
98    { lineNumber  :: LineNumber    -- ^ Line number, from 1.
99    , lineContent :: String        -- ^ Line content without newline.
100    , lineTokens  :: [a]           -- ^ Tokens in the line.
101    } deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
102
103instance (B.GetCodePos a) => B.GetCodePos (CodeLine a) where
104    getCPs (CodeLine _ _ ts) = B.getCPs $ head ts
105
106-- | Type for indent size.
107type IndentSize = Int
108
109-- | Calculate indent of line and pairing it.
110lineIndentPair :: (a -> IndentSize) -> CodeLine a -> (IndentSize, CodeLine a)
111lineIndentPair ind ln@(CodeLine _ _ (tk : _)) = (ind tk, ln)
112lineIndentPair _   ln@(CodeLine _ _ [])       = (0, ln)
113
